info.title: Personnel Data
info.description: API for reading and writing personnel data including data about attendances and absences

parameters.name: client_id
parameters.description: Client id of the downloaded credentials file

parameters.name: client_secret
parameters.description: Client secret of the downloaded credentials file

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Pagination attribute to limit the number of employees returned per page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Pagination attribute to identify the first item in the collection to return.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Find an employee with the given email address. The response is still a list, containing only the filtered employee.

total_elements.description: The total number of items matching the query filters.

total_pages.description: The total number of pages distributing sets of items matching the query filters.

current_page.description: Current page number containing the returned set of items matching with the query filters. The page number range is from 0 to total_pages - 1

type.description: The type of the field. It's only visible on custom attributes

post.description: Creates new employee. Status of the employee will be set to `active` if `hire_date` provided is in the past. Otherwise status will be set to `onboarding`. This endpoint responds with `id` of created employee in case of success.

email.description: The email field is required for the employee creation. Updating of this field is not currently supported.

subcompany.description: The subcompany employee belongs to. Should be predefined in Personio. Otherwise will be ignored with showing meta error in the response.

department.description: The department employee belongs to. Should be predefined in Personio. Otherwise will be ignored with showing meta error in the response.

office.description: The office employee belongs to. Should be predefined in Personio. Otherwise will be ignored with showing meta error in the response.

dynamic_{{ field uid }}.description: Dynamic field, represented by unique id.

patch.description: Update existing employee. Note: Updating of Email field is not currently supported.

parameters.name: employee_id
parameters.description: Numeric `id` of the employee

subcompany.description: The subcompany employee belongs to. Should be predefined in Personio. Otherwise will be ignored with showing meta error in the response.

department.description: The department employee belongs to. Should be predefined in Personio. Otherwise will be ignored with showing meta error in the response.

office.description: The office employee belongs to. Should be predefined in Personio. Otherwise will be ignored with showing meta error in the response.

dynamic_{{ field uid }}.description: Dynamic field, represented by unique id.

parameters.name: employee_id
parameters.description: Numeric `id` of the employee

type.description: The type of the field. It's only visible on custom attributes

get.description: Retrieve the absence balance for a specific employee

parameters.name: employee_id
parameters.description: Numeric `id` of the employee

type.description: The type of the field. It's only visible on custom attributes

get.description: Show employee's profile picture. If profile picture is missing, the 404 error will be thrown. The `Profile Picture` attribute has to be whitelisted.

parameters.name: employee_id
parameters.description: Numeric `id` of the employee

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: Width of the image. Default is original size

404.description: When the employee doesn't exist or employee doesn't have profile picture set or Profile Picture attribute is not whitelisted, this error occurs.

get.description: Fetch attendance data for the company employees. The result can be `paginated` and `filtered` by period, the date and/or time they were updated, and/or specific employee/employees. The result contains a list of attendances.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: First day of the period to be queried. It is inclusive, so the day specified as start_date will also be considered on the results

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: Last day of the period to be queried. It is inclusive, so the day specified as end_date will also be considered on the results.

parameters.name: updated_from
parameters.description: Datetime from when the queried periods have been updated. Same format as updated_at. It is inclusive, so the day specified as updated_from will also be considered on the results. Can be just the date, or the date and the time, with or without the timezone.

parameters.name: updated_to
parameters.description: Datetime until when the queried periods have been updated. Same format as updated_at. It is inclusive, so the day specified as updated_to will also be considered on the results. Can be just the date, or the date and the time, with or without the timezone.

parameters.name: includePending
parameters.description: Returns AttendancePeriods with a status of pending, rejected and confirmed. For pending periods, the end_date attribute is nullable. The status of each period is included in the response.

parameters.name: employees[]
parameters.description: A list of Personio employee ID's to filter the results. The result filters including only absences of provided employees

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Pagination attribute to limit how many attendances are per page

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Pagination attribute to identify which page you are requesting, by the form of telling an offset from the first record that would be returned.

total_elements.description: The total number of items matching the query filters.

total_pages.description: The total number of pages distributing sets of items matching the query filters.

current_page.description: Current page number containing the returned set of items matching with the query filters. The page number range is from 0 to total_pages - 1

post.description: This endpoint is responsible for adding attendance data for the company employees. It is possible to add attendances for one or many employees at the same time. The payload sent on the request should be a list of attendance periods, in the form of an array containing attendance period objects.

skip_approval.description: Optional, default value is true. If set to false, the approval status of the attendance period will be "pending" if an approval rule is set for the attendances type. The respective approval flow will be triggered.

schema.title: Create a New Attendance Period request

skip_approval.description: Optional, default value is true. If set to false, the approval status of the attendance period will be "pending" if an approval rule is set for the attendances type. The respective approval flow will be triggered.

requestBody.description: List of attendance periods to create

message.example: Error when trying to insert Attendances periods rows

error.message: Error when trying to insert Attendances periods rows

delete.description: This endpoint is responsible for deleting attendance data for the company employees.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the attendance period to delete

parameters.name: skip_approval
parameters.description: Optional, default value is true. If set to false, the approval status of the attendance period will be "pending" if an approval rule is set for the attendances type. The respective approval flow will be triggered.

message.example: The attendance period was not found.

error.message: The attendance period was not found.

patch.description: This endpoint is responsible for updating attendance data for the company employees. Attributes are not required and if not specified, the current value will be used. It is not possible to change the employee id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the attendance period to update

skip_approval.description: Optional, default value is true. If set to false, the approval status of the attendance period will be "pending" if an approval rule is set for the attendances type. The respective approval flow will be triggered.

message.example: The attendance period was not found.

error.message: The attendance period was not found.

get.description: Provides a list of available absences types. For example 'Paid vacation', 'Parental leave' or 'Home office'

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Pagination attribute to limit how many records will be returned per page

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Pagination attribute to identify which page you are requesting, by the form of telling an offset from the first record that would be returned.

certification_submission_timeframe.description: The timeframe in days under which the employee needs to submit the certification

get.description: This endpoint is responsible for fetching absence data for the company employees.The result can be `paginated` and `filtered` by period and/or specific employee/employees. The result contains a list of absence periods.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: First day of the period to be queried. It is inclusive, so the result starts from and including the provided `start_date`

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: Last day of the period to be queried. It is inclusive, so the result ends on `end_date` including absences from the `end_date`

parameters.name: updated_from
parameters.description: Query the periods that created or modified from the date `updated_from`. It is inclusive, so all the periods created or modified from the beginning of the `updated_from` will be included in the results

parameters.name: updated_to
parameters.description: Query the periods that created or modified until the date `updated_to`. It is inclusive, so all the periods created or modified until the end of the `updated_to` will be included in the results

parameters.name: employees[]
parameters.description: A list of Personio employee ID's to filter the results. The result filters including only absences of provided employees

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Pagination attribute to limit how many attendances is returning per page

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Pagination attribute to identify which page you are requesting, by the form of telling an offset from the first record that would be returned.

total_elements.description: The total number of items matching the query filters.

total_pages.description: The total number of pages distributing sets of items matching the query filters.

current_page.description: Current page number containing the returned set of items matching with the query filters. The page number range is from 0 to total_pages - 1

post.description: This endpoint is responsible for adding absence data for the company employees.

half_day_start.description: Weather the start date is a half-day off

half_day_end.description: Weather the end date is a half-day off

skip_approval.description: Optional, default value is true. If set to false, the approval status of the absence request will be "pending" if an approval rule is set for the absence type in Personio. The respective approval flow will be triggered.

201.description: The absence period is successfully created

message.example: Error when trying to insert absence period

error.message: Error when trying to insert absence period

404.description: Employee or Absence type not found

message.example: The given data failed to pass validation.

error.message: The given data failed to pass validation.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the absence period to delete

message.example: The absence period was not found.

error.message: The absence period was not found.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Numeric `id` of the absence period
